    Class AppCanvas

    A specific implementation of the BOOSE ICanvas interface.

    This class uses GDI+ (System.Drawing) to perform graphical operations on a Bitmap surface.

    Inheritance
    object
    AppCanvas
    Implements
    ICanvas

    public class AppCanvas : ICanvas

    Constructors

    AppCanvas(int, int)

    Initializes a new instance of the AppCanvas class with the specified canvas dimensions.

    Declaration
    public AppCanvas(int width, int height)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int width

    The width, in pixels, of the canvas to create. Must be greater than zero.
    int height

    The height, in pixels, of the canvas to create. Must be greater than zero.

    Methods

    Circle(int, bool)

    Draws a circle with the specified radius at the current position, optionally filled or outlined.

    Declaration
    public void Circle(int radius, bool filled)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int radius

    The radius of the circle, in pixels. Must be a non-negative value.
    bool filled

    A value indicating whether the circle should be filled (true) or only outlined (false).

    Clear()

    Clears the drawing surface and fills it with a white background.

    Declaration
    public void Clear()
    Remarks

    Use this method to reset the graphics surface before starting a new drawing operation. All existing content will be removed and replaced with a solid white fill.

    DrawTo(int, int)

    Draws a line from the current position to the specified coordinates and updates the current position to the new point.

    Declaration
    public void DrawTo(int x, int y)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int x

    The x-coordinate of the destination point to which the line will be drawn.
    int y

    The y-coordinate of the destination point to which the line will be drawn.
    Remarks

    After drawing the line, the current position is set to the specified coordinates. Subsequent drawing operations will start from this new position.

    MoveTo(int, int)

    Sets the object's position to the specified X and Y coordinates.

    Declaration
    public void MoveTo(int x, int y)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int x

    The new horizontal position, in units, to move the object to.
    int y

    The new vertical position, in units, to move the object to.

    Rect(int, int, bool)

    Draws a rectangle at the current position with the specified width and height.

    Declaration
    public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int width

    The width, in pixels, of the rectangle to draw. Must be greater than zero.
    int height

    The height, in pixels, of the rectangle to draw. Must be greater than zero.
    bool filled

    Indicates whether the rectangle should be filled (true) or only its outline should be drawn (false).

    Reset()

    Resets the pen position to the default starting coordinates.

    Declaration
    public void Reset()
    Remarks

    After calling this method, the pen position is set to the top-left corner. Use this method to reinitialize the drawing position before starting a new drawing operation.

    Set(int, int)

    Sets the dimensions using the specified width and height values.

    Declaration
    public void Set(int width, int height)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int width

    The width value to set. Must be a non-negative integer.
    int height

    The height value to set. Must be a non-negative integer.
    Exceptions
    Type Condition
    NotImplementedException

    Thrown in all cases as the method is not yet implemented.

    SetColour(int, int, int)

    Sets the color of the pen using the specified red, green, and blue component values.

    Declaration
    public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int red

    The red component of the color. Must be an integer between 0 and 255, inclusive.
    int green

    The green component of the color. Must be an integer between 0 and 255, inclusive.
    int blue

    The blue component of the color. Must be an integer between 0 and 255, inclusive.

    Tri(int, int)

    Draws a triangle shape with the specified width and height.

    Declaration
    public void Tri(int width, int height)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    int width

    The width of the triangle, in pixels. Must be a positive integer.
    int height

    The height of the triangle, in pixels. Must be a positive integer.
    Exceptions
    Type Condition
    NotImplementedException

    Always thrown, as this method is not yet implemented.

    WriteText(string)

    Writes the specified text to the output destination.

    Declaration
    public void WriteText(string text)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    string text

    The text to write. If null or empty, no content will be written.
    Exceptions
    Type Condition
    NotImplementedException

    Thrown in all cases as the method is not yet implemented.

    getBitmap()

    Returns the current bitmap associated with the canvas.

    Declaration
    public object getBitmap()
    Returns
    Type Description
    object

    An object representing the canvas bitmap. The specific type and contents depend on the implementation.
